value.title: Power BI date table: create using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to create a Power BI date table using DAX. The end result uses a combination of the GENERATE(), ROW() and CALENDARAUTO() DAX functions to create a calculated table resulting in a Power BI date table.  Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-generate-and-row-instead-of-addcolumns-in-dax/

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day - 03: Power BI Reporting - Part 2
value.excerpt: In this video, we demonstrate viewing two reports, one a Power BI report, and the other a paginated report.  The Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day online course aims to empower you as a report author with the technical knowledge required to create, publish, and distribute Power BI paginated reports.

value.excerpt: There are different methods to use row-level security in Power BI; You can set up Row Level Security in Power BI itself or through a live connection from a data source such as SSAS Tabular. However, row-level security defined in the ways mentioned in the articles above isn‚Äôt dynamic. By dynamic row-level

value.title: Showing actuals and forecasts in the same chart with Power BI
value.excerpt: In budgeting reports, a common requirement is to show future sales forecast and actual sales volume on the same line chart. Learn how to achieve this goal using DAX. value.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: Getting started with Power BI Paginated Reports (2021)
value.excerpt: Not sure what Power BI Paginated Reports are or how to use them? Patrick walks you through and points you to some great resources to get up and running quickly.  Power BI Paginated Reports require either Power BI Premium Per User or Power BI Premium capacity.  Paginated Report In a Day: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/learning-catalog/paginated-reports-online-course

value.excerpt: If you have too many items in a slicer, such as the list of customer names, or product names, then finding one amongst the list takes time, unless you enable the search. Fortunately, the search is there for you, you just need to enable it, In this very short article and video, I‚Äôll explain where it is

value.title: Get data in Power BI
value.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

value.title: ChatGPT blew my mind with this Power BI scenario

value.title: Explore what Power BI can do for you
value.excerpt: As a consumer, you'll work in the Power BI service to review and interact with content that has been shared with you. This module provides the foundational information that you need to work effectively in the Power BI service.

value.title: Building relationships between tables when both have duplicates
value.excerpt: PowerPivot and Power BI Desktop only allow the creation of relationships between tables when one of columns forming the relationship does not have duplicate values.  In order to relate these two tables to one another, what we need is a third table with all distinct values from both tables. In this tutorial

value.title: Using Power BI gateways to connect to data sources
value.excerpt: Learn all about the On-Premises Data Gateway and how it is used with the Power BI service. The Power BI gateway can be used to refresh imported data as well as allow you to use DirectQuery or connect live to an Analysis Services mode.

topItems.title: A new way to manage gateways in Power BI!!!

value.title: Get started with Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Get started and explore the capabilities of Microsoft Fabric.

topItems.title: Introduction to end-to-end analytics using Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Discover how Microsoft Fabric can meet your enterprise's analytics needs in one platform. Discover the capabilities Fabric has to offer, understand how it works, and identify how you can use Fabric for your analytics needs.

topItems.title: Get started with lakehouses in Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Get started with lakehouses in Microsoft Fabric

topItems.title: Use Apache Spark in Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Apache Spark is a core technology for large-scale data analytics. Microsoft Fabric provides support for Spark clusters, enabling you to analyze and process data at scale.

topItems.title: Work with Delta Lake tables in Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Tables in a Microsoft Fabric lakehouse are based on the Delta Lake technology commonly used in Apache Spark. By using the enhanced capabilities of delta tables, you can create advanced analytics solutions.
